definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
to scrape the meat from bones/to pick (teeth etc)/to weed out

sentences.english: That doesn't mean that offline access to web apps has been perfected.
sentences.chinese: 这并不意味着离线访问网络应用程序已经无可挑剔了。

sentences.english: Behave flawlessly at the wedding and reception.
sentences.chinese: 在婚礼和婚宴上表现的无可挑剔。

sentences.english: But Daniel was blameless , for he was loyal to both God and the King.
sentences.chinese: 可但以理对王对上帝都忠心耿耿，无可挑剔。

sentences.english: Even from a technical point of view it's a nice result.
sentences.chinese: 即便是从技术角度上看这也是无可挑剔的结果。

sentences.english: I have no fault to find with his work.
sentences.chinese: 我对他的工作无可挑剔。

sentences.english: But their precise production process is nothing to scoff at.
sentences.chinese: 但是它们精确的生产过程无可挑剔。

sentences.english: Minnelli's sensibilities were perfect for it – the sensitivity and the bravado.
sentences.chinese: 明奈利对情感与虚张声势的拿捏是无可挑剔的。

sentences.english: It was one of those perfect English spring days.
sentences.chinese: 那是英国的春季的无可挑剔的一天。

sentences.english: Although she's dressed up to the nines. At sixes and sevens with you.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她的打扮无可挑剔，却与你格格不入。

sentences.english: Stock to be cleared is unrivaled in both variety and quality.
sentences.chinese: 清仓商品无论种类还是质量都无可挑剔。

sentences.english: Above evidence sounds suddenly it seems that very reasonable, spotless .
sentences.chinese: 以上证据乍一听起来似乎很有道理，无可挑剔。

sentences.english: Although she's dressed up to the nines, at sixes and sevens with you.
sentences.chinese: 虽然她的打扮得无可挑剔，却与你格格不入。

definition: see 沒說的|没说的[mei2 shuo1 de5]
perfect and without blemish/flawless/to leave nothing to be desired
to be underwhelmed/to be less than impressed
can be rated as/can be said to be
lit. a blemish does not obscure jade's luster/the pros outweigh the cons (idiom)
